com.hazelcast.query.impl

Class Indexes

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.query.impl.Indexes

  • public class Indexes
extends Object
    Contains all indexes for a data-structure, e.g. an IMap.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Indexes.Builder
      Builder which is used to create a new Indexes object.

    • Method Detail

      • addOrGetIndex

        public InternalIndex addOrGetIndex(String attribute,
                                   boolean ordered)
        Obtains the existing index or creates a new one (if an index doesn't exist yet) for the given attribute in this indexes instance.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute to index.
        ordered - true if the new index should be ordered, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        the existing or created index.

      • getIndexes

        public InternalIndex[] getIndexes()
        Returns all the indexes known to this indexes instance.

      • destroyIndexes

        public void destroyIndexes()
        Destroys and then removes all the indexes from this indexes instance.

      • clearAll

        public void clearAll()
        Clears contents of indexes managed by this instance.

      • hasIndex

        public boolean hasIndex()
        Returns true if this indexes instance contains at least one index, false otherwise.

      • saveEntryIndex

        public void saveEntryIndex(QueryableEntry queryableEntry,
                           Object oldValue,
                           Index.OperationSource operationSource)
        Inserts a new queryable entry into this indexes instance or updates the existing one.
        Parameters:
        queryableEntry - the queryable entry to insert or update.
        oldValue - the old entry value to update, null if inserting the new entry.
        operationSource - the operation source.

      • removeEntryIndex

        public void removeEntryIndex(Data key,
                             Object value,
                             Index.OperationSource operationSource)
        Removes the entry from this indexes instance identified by the given key and value.
        Parameters:
        key - the key if the entry to remove.
        value - the value of the entry to remove.
        operationSource - the operation source.

      • isGlobal

        public boolean isGlobal()
        Returns:
        true if the index is global-per map, meaning there is just a single instance of this object per map. Global indexes are used in on-heap maps, since they give a significant performance boost. The opposite of global indexes are partitioned-indexes which are stored locally per partition. In case of a partitioned-index, each query has to query the index in each partition separately, which all-together may be around 3 times slower than querying a single global index.

      • getIndex

        public InternalIndex getIndex(String attribute)
        Get index for a given attribute. If the index does not exist then returns null.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute name to get the index of.
        Returns:
        Index for attribute or null if the index does not exist.

      • query

        public Set<QueryableEntry> query(Predicate predicate)
        Performs a query on this indexes instance using the given predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the predicate to evaluate.
        Returns:
        the produced result set or null if the query can't be performed using the indexes known to this indexes instance.

      • getIndexesStats

        public IndexesStats getIndexesStats()
        Returns the indexes stats of this indexes instance.

      • newBuilder

        public static Indexes.Builder newBuilder(SerializationService ss,
                                         IndexCopyBehavior indexCopyBehavior)
        Parameters:
        ss - the serializationService
        indexCopyBehavior - the indexCopyBehavior
        Returns:
        new builder instance which will be used to create Indexes object.
        See Also:
        IndexCopyBehavior
